H0.text: To control population size, trees like oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels.

H1.text: To pollinate their flowers is why trees such as oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels.

H2.text: To remove dead wood is why trees like oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels.

H3.text: To aid in seed distribution, trees such as oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels.

A4.text: This behavior, believed to minimize fungal infections and reduce the risk of food loss, also inadvertently aids certain trees, like Cyclobalanopsis, in expanding their range, with forgotten or dislodged nuts sprouting in new locations, influencing forest ecology.
